about.title: About Petrotreatment

story.title: Our Story & Mission
story.founding: Petrotreatment was officially founded in May 2014 as an Egyptian joint-stock company, building on the legacy of sister companies operating since 1996, including Petroleum Services, Al Masrya Transport Company, and Al Assrya for Petroleum and Environmental Services.
story.specialization: We specialize in comprehensive waste management - from collection and transportation to treatment and safe disposal. Our services include industrial tank cleaning, sludge handling, oil treatment operations, and construction of specialized treatment facilities.
story.mission: With our modern fleet equipped with the latest safety standards and our dedicated treatment plant serving coastal areas, North Sinai, South Sinai, and the Delta, we deliver environmental solutions that meet international standards while driving sustainable development.

sinai.description: This project plays a pivotal role in Sinai, given its strategic location at the heart of the region, serving as a central hub for the treatment of water associated with oil and gas production. Backed by a dedicated team of experts, it ensures the application of best practices to maximize efficiency and environmental impact.

envEngineer.title: Environmental Engineer
envEngineer.description: Join our engineering team to design and implement environmental solutions for waste management and treatment systems. You'll work on cutting-edge projects that make a real difference in environmental protection.
responsibilities: Design environmental treatment systems and processes
Conduct environmental impact assessments
Monitor compliance with environmental regulations
Collaborate with cross-functional teams on project implementation
Prepare technical reports and documentation
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Environmental Engineering or related field
3-5 years of experience in environmental engineering
Knowledge of environmental regulations and standards
Proficiency in CAD software and environmental modeling tools
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills in Arabic and English

safetySpecialist.title: Safety Specialist
safetySpecialist.description: Ensure the highest safety standards across our operations. You'll develop safety protocols, conduct training, and maintain our excellent safety record in hazardous waste management.
responsibilities: Develop and implement safety protocols and procedures
Conduct safety training sessions for employees
Perform regular safety inspections and audits
Investigate incidents and recommend corrective actions
Maintain safety documentation and records
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Occupational Health & Safety or related field
2-4 years of experience in industrial safety
NEBOSH or IOSH certification preferred
Knowledge of ISO 45001 and safety regulations
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Ability to work in challenging field conditions

projectManager.title: Project Manager
projectManager.description: Lead complex environmental projects from conception to completion. You'll manage cross-functional teams, coordinate with clients, and ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget.
responsibilities: Manage multiple environmental projects simultaneously
Coordinate with clients, contractors, and internal teams
Develop project schedules, budgets, and resource allocation
Monitor project progress and manage risks
Ensure quality standards and regulatory compliance
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business, or related field
5-8 years of project management experience
PMP certification preferred
Experience in environmental or construction projects
Strong leadership and communication skills
Proficiency in project management software

fieldTechnician.title: Field Technician
fieldTechnician.description: Work hands-on with our state-of-the-art equipment in the field. You'll be responsible for equipment operation, maintenance, and ensuring smooth field operations across various client sites.
responsibilities: Operate and maintain treatment equipment
Perform routine inspections and preventive maintenance
Collect samples and conduct field tests
Document operational data and maintenance activities
Coordinate with site supervisors and clients
requirements: Technical diploma or certificate in mechanical/chemical engineering
1-3 years of experience in industrial operations
Knowledge of mechanical and electrical systems
Ability to work in outdoor and challenging environments
Strong practical problem-solving skills
Valid driver's license
